resources.string: Hi, \n So you wanted to learn how to build an android app with no prior coding experience ?\nDon\'t worry, this app might be the perfect start for you in 2018.
Learn from variety of sources.\nI\'m sure this will help the beginners to get started.
Have patience and faith.\nIt takes time but i promise it worth\'s.
Can you believe the application you are viewing, it\'s source can be freely downloaded from GitHub?\nNavigate to the Source Code section for more.

This application is a collection of documentation and links of tutorials that will help the beginners get started with Android Development using Java. This application consists of all of the links, youtube videos, channels, online courses that are intended for Application development for Android using Java. All of the courses and videos that are listed within this application are free and legal. 

It consist of courses for beginners and intermediate level. For anyone just starting, they have to start from the beginners section and is recommended to do so.The beginners course is targeted for people with less to no knowledge in Android app development . The intermediate level of the courses provided here will focus on Java as programming language with designing tutorials too. After you are done with the beginners and intermediate courses you should be able to develop simple application and designs easily. 

The YouTube section will help you get started to build up the strong intermediate level. Here some of the best channels which focuses on Android development are listed which is even handy for beginners however for complete beginners it is recommended to start from the Beginners section. 
 
Android Official Documentation is also one of the best place to study and research on android app development. This consist all of the documentation. Go through the docs if you get stuck in any attributes and syntax. 
 
Also i have decided to upload the source code of this application so that anyone can download, see it and even make changes and distribute them freely. However giving credit is the only thing you should not forget. Getting the links to the source code is bit tricky though, but i promise it is within the app. 

Let me tell you my secret, i also started from the beginners section and here i am building this application even without completing the half of the intermediate level course.

This is the beginners section which will help you get started in Android Development. It is recommended for the beginners. All the courses are pulled from Udacity and are completely free. This is easy and intended for anyone even for those who have never programmed in Android.\n\nThe following listed are the courses where each courses have different videos and projects inside and users should not skip any of the lessons.

This is the Intermediate section. User should navigate and start this course only after the completion of Beginners Section. This section will help you cover more than the basics and might introduce you to the Java programming language so you can start writing functions and events for your activities.\n\nTechniques behind the app monetization and Firebase are introduced in the section which also means after the completion of the courses listed in the section you will be at least able to make a simple app, monetize it and upload it in the Google Play.

This section will help you to increase your strength in intermediate level of programming in Android. Here some of the best channels from YouTube are listed where you will be able to learn Android Development. Channels are not placed in any order which also means all of the channels are best. It is the decision of yours to decide which channel is best for you. If you are one of the creators creating quality youtube videos in Android Development, do comment in the Google Play review section to add your channel here. We will review and upadate it accordingly.
Image of Prabeesh RK YouTube Channel
Image of Oum Saokosal YouTube Channel
Youtube Channel for the new boston

The best place to search whether you are learning android or developing application is the \"Official Android Documentation\" site. The site has everything you need to know about developing apps in Android. \n\nInformation about the views, their attributes and syntax are written there. It will be a goto site if you are developing application as you may forget the attributes sometime which is normal, everyone can\'t remember everything.

As a programmer i always wondered how application and software are written,how many of lines of code does it take to write a working complete application etc. This is the reason i have decided to share the source code of the application you are currently using. And i\'m sure that this will help the beginners to rectify their mistakes in code and the way codes are written for any features or function which are implemented within the application. \n\nHowever getting the source code of this application is bit tricky but i promise, you will get the link to the source code within the app. Also do share your experience about the application and the time you took to find out the link to the source code in the Google Play reviews and ratings section.
